meanings.sent1: The little girl's mishap with the ice cream cone made her cry.
meanings.sent2: The car crash was a serious mishap that caused a lot of damage.
meanings.sent3: Tom's mishap with the spilled juice turned into a slippery situation.
meanings.sent4: The team's mishap on the field was like a sudden storm disrupting their game.
meanings.sent5: The mishap at the party left a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: To have an accident or make a mistake.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't mishap while baking the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mishap when she's nervous about public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to mishap every time it tried to jump onto the high shelf.
meanings.sent4: His plan to surprise his friend might mishap if she finds out too soon.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick could mishap if he doesn't practice enough.
